summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking production of documentary and tangible evidence related to a victim (Doe) of Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse from 2002-2010. The letter requests specific records including photographs, videos, correspondence, gift purchases, and payments made on behalf of the victim to support her civil litigation and participation in the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.

locations: 86 Chambers Street, Third Floor, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document reveals a specific victim (Doe) was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein from 2002 through 2010, starting when she was 17 years old.
Epstein provided the victim with medical treatments, legal counsel, commercial flights, housing, and items of value, creating a paper trail of evidence.
The Epstein Victim Compensation Program was underway at the time of this request, and the victim sought evidence to support her claim.
The attorneys requested 11 specific categories of documentary evidence including photographs, videos, correspondence, gift records, and payment records related to the victim.
The victim filed a civil lawsuit under the pseudonym 'Doe' in SDNY Case No. 1:19-cv-07773 against Darren K. Indyke and others.
